scenarios.title: The Automation Pilot
scenarios.prompt: The municipality seeks to implement a Large Language Model (LLM) as a copilot for caseworkers, anticipating a 20% increase in productivity and an 8% risk of role displacement, while ensuring quality monitoring. How would you approach this?

choices.A: Deploy the large language model (LLM), initiate a reskilling program, and ensure a smooth transition for the pay-to-stay process.
choices.B: Implement phased pilot programs that include worker councils and establish guardrails for algorithmic management.
choices.C: Demand no rollout until wage-sharing and job quality guarantees are officially established.

scenarios.toolkit_cues: What does a just transition require here? What guardrails and KPIs prove it?
scenarios.p3_cues: People (dignity/autonomy), Planet (compute intensity), Parity (who gains from productivity).

scenarios.title: Shift Scheduler
scenarios.prompt: A warehouse struggles with shift scheduling, causing overstaffing and burnout. Managers are considering implementing an algorithm-based system to optimize schedules. What would you do?

choices.A: Involve workers in the design process and prioritize their needs while combining algorithmic scheduling with manual adjustments.
choices.B: Decide to implement the algorithm on a trial basis.
choices.C: Reject algorithm-based systems; prioritize well-being and work-life balance through current scheduling and regular manager-staff meetings.

scenarios.toolkit_cues: How does scheduling affect burnout vs. stability? What co-designed alternatives fit?

scenarios.title: Live Call Coach
scenarios.prompt: In a busy call center, agents face long wait times and inconsistent service. Management mandates the use of an AI-driven Live Call Coach, which suggests responses in real time. What action would you take?

choices.A: Support the mandate and implement comprehensive training for agents on using the AI tool effectively, ensuring they can adapt suggestions to fit their style.
choices.B: Limit AI suggestions to specific scenarios where agents may struggle and encourage independent problem-solving in other situations.
choices.C: Implement the Live Call Coach without training, understanding that this may boost efficiency but also risks agent frustration and misuse.

scenarios.toolkit_cues: What surveillance and skill-loss risks exist? Where should assist be limited?
scenarios.p3_cues: People (morale/agency), Planet (compute per call), Parity (advancement paths).

scenarios.title: Gig 'Quality' Tiers
scenarios.prompt: A new gig-economy platform connects freelancers with job opportunities and ranks them based on performance and customer feedback. However, workers in lower tiers face limited job access and financial uncertainty. What would you recommend?

choices.A: Maintain the tier system, publish evaluation criteria openly, and expedite the appeals process for ranking challenges.
choices.B: Eliminate tiers and create a randomized pool to guarantee equal job opportunities for freelancers.
choices.C: Establish union-negotiated tier structures that guarantee a minimum level of job access regardless of performance metrics.

scenarios.toolkit_cues: How do tiers shift income and access? What transparent floors and appeals are needed?
scenarios.p3_cues: People (income swings), Planet (routing), Parity (bias by rating).

scenarios.title: Public Office Re-skilling
scenarios.prompt: Automation has rendered many clerical roles in public offices obsolete. Budget resources can either fund severance packages or facilitate re-skilling programs to prepare employees for new opportunities and challenges. What would be your choice?

choices.A: Offer comprehensive severance packages, with a commitment to prioritize re-hiring for suitable roles in the future.
choices.B: Provide fully funded training programs aimed at equipping employees with skills for higher-demand positions.
choices.C: A hybrid approach of reduced hours with shared-work arrangements, combined with robust training opportunities for skill development.

scenarios.toolkit_cues: Who should share automation gains? What mix of severance, training, and shared work is fair?
